item.title: Unit6-Part3: 职业
item.author: Oasis
item.description: lieber “Lieber” is a German word with multiple meanings and uses, largely depending on the context in which it is used. Here are the primary ways “lieber” is used in German: As a Comparative Form of “Gern” (to like): “Ich trinke lieber Kaffee als Tee.” – “I prefer to drink coffee rather than tea.” In this context, “lieber” means “rather” or “preferably” and is used to express a preference. item.title: 2023.9.14～2023.9.17 东京，日本
item.author: Oasis
item.description: 东京！虽然这次行程十分仓促，不过于我而言似乎也已经足够了，再额外增加时间，似乎也只能再四处逛逛，多看几个地标与建筑，多吃几顿当地有口皆碑的美食。或许每个城市对于旅行的人来说，总有被钦慕的地方
